intro: Rayeria teretifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved rayeria, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woods or along stream banks. Rayeria teretifolia is noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
